structure.unit: A EXECUTIVE BRANCH CODE OF ETHICS

text.section:
The principles of ethical behavior for public servants shall recognize that:
Those who hold positions of public trust, and members of their families, also have certain business and financial interests;
Those in government service are often involved in policy decisions that pose a potential conflict with some personal financial interest; and
Standards of ethical conduct for the executive branch of state government are needed to determine those conflicts of interest which are substantial and material or which, by the nature of the conflict of interest, tend to bring public servants into disrepute.

law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 287, sec. 2, effective July 14, 1992.
